meanings.definition: To behave in an affected or exaggeratedly effeminate manner.
meanings.sent1: He was pouncing around the room, pretending to be a princess.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys pouncing with dramatic gestures when telling stories.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was pouncing in his mother's high heels, trying to be funny.
meanings.sent4: Her pouncing movements on stage were like a graceful ballet dancer.
meanings.sent5: The actor's pouncing performance left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To wander about aimlessly or idly.
meanings.sent1: The cat was poncing through the garden, chasing butterflies.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his homework, he decided to poncing around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The lost tourist was poncing in circles, unable to find the right direction.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were poncing from one idea to another, never settling.
meanings.sent5: The clouds were poncing lazily across the sky, without a care.

meanings.definition: To live off the earnings of a prostitute.
meanings.sent1: The criminal was poncing off the vulnerable women on the street.
meanings.sent2: He was caught poncing on the hard work of others, without contributing.
meanings.sent3: The lazy man was poncing from one woman to another, without a job.
meanings.sent4: His lavish lifestyle was poncing on the sacrifices of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was poncing on the trust of his victims, deceiving them.
